treatment.description: Cells are slender, cylindrical, irregularly crooked rods, 0.35-0.6 µm in diameter and 3-7 µm in length. Frequent filaments of 10-120 µm long. Habitat: thermophilic, anaerobic, sewage sludge digestors. Cells Gram-positive. Nonmotile. Cells produce fimbriae. Strictly anaerobic. Fastest growth between 55˚C and 65˚C. Energy metabolism by the reduction of CO2 to CH4, with H2 as the electron donor. Formate is not used as a substrate for methanogenesis. Capable of growth between pH 7-8. Sulfur is reduced to sulfide. Ammonia is the sole nitrogen source, and sulfide may serve as the sulfur source. The mol% G+C is 49 (Tm).
